command.description: Scan for changes to original files and folders
command.name: Refresh
Open a copy in system's editor

command.label: New Project
command.tooltip: Create a new project within this workspace.

command.label: Link Originals
command.tooltip: Link a project to the location of a some original files.

perspective.name: Capture
perspective.description: This perspective arranges the user interface to support media inventory, accession and deaccession. It also supports overview of the original file structures and staging status.

perspective.name: Arrange
perspective.description: The Arrange perspective configures the user interface to support description and arrangement of the collection or deposit structure.

perspective.name: Metadata
perspective.description: The Metadata perspective support batch metadata operations at the item level. This is where you import original metadata sources in various formats, map the metadata records to digital objects and cross-walk metadata fields to standard schemas.

perspective.name: METS
perspective.description: The METS perspective allows the user to browse the underlying METS document in which all standard workbench information is recorded for each project.

commonFilter.description: This filter allows you to hide the link items, which are otherwise shown immediately under the divs where the links originate.
commonFilter.name: Hide Links on Divs (METS smLink)

commonFilter.description: These are resources that are managed by the workbench software and generally not shown.
commonFilter.name: Workbench Managed Folders

property.name: introTitle
property.value: Wecome to the Curator's Workbench - Version 3

property.name: aboutText
property.value:
Curator's Workbench, version 3
The Curator's Workbench is a project of the Carolina Digital Repository, created by the University Libraries of UNC Chapel Hill. http://cdr.unc.edu
This software is open source, you can participate in development on GitHub: http://github.com/UNC-Libraries/Curators-Workbench
This project was also supported by a grant from the International Council in Archives http://www.ica.org
Lead Developer: Gregory N. Jansen, count0@email.unc.edu
Project Team: Erin O'Meara Jill Sexton
Special thanks to: Jackie Dean Barrie E. Hayes Michele Hayslett Rosalyn P. Holdzkom Biff Hollingsworth
